name: 2,5-dimethoxybenzeneboronic acid
Reason: 2,5-dimethoxybenzeneboronic acid has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The methoxy groups in this compound increase the melting point due to their ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 °C each. The boronic acid moiety also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, estimated at around +20 °C. The presence of two additional phenyl groups linked in a linear fashion would augment the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions and molecular weight, estimated at around +30 °C for each additional phenyl group.
